meanings.definition: To touch or stroke gently with the hand.
meanings.sent1: She patted the puppy's head softly.
meanings.sent2: He patted his friend on the back to show support.
meanings.sent3: The cat patted the ball around playfully.
meanings.sent4: The wind patted the leaves against the window.
meanings.sent5: Grandma patted the dough with care as she baked.

meanings.definition: To tap lightly with the hand or a flat object.
meanings.sent1: He patted the table to get her attention.
meanings.sent2: She patted the dust off the book gently.
meanings.sent3: The chef patted the dough to shape it into a circle.
meanings.sent4: The rain patted the roof softly all night.
meanings.sent5: The child patted the keys on the piano with curiosity.
